plants.name: Rhododendron ponticum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub known for its large clusters of purple to pink trumpet-shaped flowers. It is widely found in temperate regions and often blooms in early to mid-spring.
plants.location: Temperate regions of Europe and western Asia
plants.funFact: Rhododendrons are important nectar sources for bees and butterflies in spring.

plants.name: Magnolia Ã— soulangeana
plants.description: A deciduous tree or large shrub with spectacular large, cup-shaped flowers that appear before the leaves in early spring.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, commonly cultivated in gardens
plants.funFact: Magnolia flowers predate bees; they evolved to be pollinated by beetles.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: A native Australian tree or large shrub producing large cylindrical yellow flower spikes, known for attracting birds and mammals.
plants.bloomingSeason: April to August (autumn and winter in Australia)
plants.funFact: Banksia flowers produce abundant nectar that supports a variety of wildlife.

plants.name: Ipomoea purpurea
plants.description: A fast-growing vine producing trumpet-shaped flowers with vibrant colors, opening in the morning and closing by afternoon.
plants.location: Tropical and subtropical regions worldwide, often cultivated
plants.funFact: Morning glories are known for their rapid growth and twining habit, often covering fences and trellises.
